result.execSummary:
The defendant James Lee Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 09-19-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*With credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Lee Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Lee Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 09-19-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant James Lee Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Milwaukee County JC Penney's stores and Southridge Mall.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Lee Thomas in court.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 21 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James Lee Thomas
Current: 1220 W. Vliet Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 01-21-2016)
Prior: PO Box 4881, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01-21-2016 at 01:30pm
